page.title: 12ROCKINGHAM TRIANGLE.
page.content: Rockingham Triangle recreation area was originally farmland. Now converted for rugby, soccer, cricket,athletics, gaelic football and in the future American football. A fenced arena has just been completed for the use of Corby Town football and athletic clubs. The athletics track will be the first in the county with a regional standard surface. In addition to its all weather, eight lane running track, the stadium has a covered seating stand for up to 1000 spectators. Clubs using the council pitches, rent them on a casual or block hire scheme. The current rate for the hire of a pitch with changing facilities is #16.55 per game. Teams can make a block hiring and obtain a 36 match concession for #132. This would give them exclusive use of the area for the period of their contract.
